page.title: 19Swansea Jack
page.content: {People born and bred in Swansea are {nicknamed 'Swansea Jacks'. The original Swansea Jack was a small terrier dog who became famous in the 1930's for rescuing people from the sea. He saved 27 people and won many awards for this including the dogs 'Victoria Cross'. He appeared with his owner at shows and carnivals raising a lot of money for charity. He died in 1937 at the age of 7 as a result of poisoning. Swansea people wanted to remember this brave dog and subscriptions provided enough money to build a monument to him on the promenade. His name is also remembered by the public house named after him near Glamorgan Street.
